description: This is the driver for the GPROFNG tools suite to gather and analyze performance data.

global_flags.description: verify if the hardware and software environment is supported.
enable (on) or disable (off) verbose mode; the default is "off".
print the version number and exit.

subcommands.name: GPROFNG_ALLOW_CORE_DUMP
subcommands.description: set this variable to allow a core file to be generated; otherwise an error report is created on /tmp.

subcommands.name: GPROFNG_ARCHIVE
subcommands.description: use this variable to define the settings for automatic archiving upon experiment recording completion.

subcommands.name: GPROFNG_ARCHIVE_COMMON_DIR
subcommands.description: set this variable to the location of the common archive.

subcommands.name: GPROFNG_JAVA_MAX_CALL_STACK_DEPTH
subcommands.description: set the depth of the Java call stack; the default is 256; set to 0 to disable capturing of call stacks.

subcommands.name: GPROFNG_JAVA_NATIVE_MAX_CALL_STACK_DEPTH
subcommands.description: set the depth of the Java native call stack; the default is 256; set to 0 to disable capturing of call stacks (JNI and assembly call stacks are not captured).

subcommands.name: GPROFNG_MAX_CALL_STACK_DEPTH
subcommands.description: set the depth of the call stack (default is 256).

subcommands.name: GPROFNG_SKIP_VALIDATION
subcommands.description: set this variable to disable checking hardware, system, and Java versions.

subcommands.name: GPROFNG_SSH_REMOTE_DISPLAY
subcommands.description: use this variable to define the ssh command executed by the remote display tool.

subcommands.name: GPROFNG_USE_JAVA_OPTIONS
subcommands.description: may be set when profiling a C/C++ application that uses dlopen() to execute Java code.
